2.26.22  11:35 pm   Hey, I know this might a long shot but I'm wondering if you would be willing to answer a couple questions for a school English project I'm doing? I'm a big fan of your music and from reading your answers here and watching the reality videos, I feel like you might have some insightful things to say on this topic.

Essentially I'm writing an essay comparing digital music production to a "selfie": they are both ways of capturing a moment in time, who you were as well as the world around you, then sharing it with people around the world through the internet. I was wondering if you could share some of your own experience with this so that I could include it in my writing? I have a couple questions:

1. Could you explain how your experiences and personality at the time shaped the music you create, and how did your music change over time as you changed a person?

     2. Do you think self-expression through music has changed at all with the advent of online music sharing, compared to before the internet, and if so how?

     3. In many ways, the music you create is an extension of yourself. Is it tough to put your music out there and be vulnerable in front of a wide audience which can now comment and give (potentially negative) feedback easily and quickly?
